snippet: The Satanic Temple, a website founded in Massachusetts, takes on all forms of organized religion, sometimes filing lawsuits but often in somewhat devious ways.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column examines origin and activities of Satanic Temple, website that has spawned anti-religion with about 20 chapters and 20,000 followers on social media; founders of site, whose real identities are not known, say concept was created in effort to confront the conservative Christian push across nation to file growing number of lawsuits based on freedom of religion.
lead_paragraph: The Satanic Temple, a website founded in Massachusetts, takes on all forms of organized religion, sometimes filing lawsuits but often in somewhat devious ways.

headline.main: A Mischievous Thorn in the Side of Conservative Christianity
headline.print_headline: A Mischievous Thorn in the Side of Conservative Christianity
